metadata.Title: CVE-2023-33595 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: CPython v3.12.0 alpha 7 was discovered to contain a heap use-after-free via the function ascii_decode at /Objects/unicodeobject.c.

notes.Note: alexmurray> This vulnerability was introduced in upstream commit 1ef61cf71a218c71860ff6aecf0fd51edb8b65dc and the fix was also committed upstream in commit d5a97074d24cd14cb2a35a2b1ad3074863cde264 - both of these were part of the 3.12.0b1 release, so no versions of python3.12 in ubuntu were affected (also no other python3.x versions are affected as the original vulnerable commit was only released during the development of python 3.12)

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
